q: Star interviews: Everyone wants to hear from Michael Vick and DeSean Jackson and Asante Samuel . That's the problem: their interviews are usually done in massive groups with serious reporters and lazy ones competing to get questions in.( How important is winning this week? Really?) It's not exactly conducive to revealing statements. Lesser-known players, who you might be able to actually have a conversation with, more often provided far deeper insight. The road: Great

to audition. There is no upper age limit. "I like the idea that a 12-year old on this show can compete with an older singer and a singing group," Simon Cowell said in a statement. judge and new CNN talkshow host told Metro that he was shocked by the powerful position to which the the Liberal Democrat leader has since risen. Asked who were his most difficult interviewees, Piers Morgan said: Ones who emerge as fairly imbecilic. Nick Clegg stands out; my GQ interview with him was a series of spectacular own goals. "I thought,' I hope he never ends up running the country' and, whoa- here he is. How can this guy be so powerful? It's frightening. Sen. Jim DeMint currently sees his role in the 2012 process, the adviser said, as "setting the bar high" for the presidential contenders when it comes to advocating for a small government agenda. He hasn't completely shut the door on running, and if there is a massive void in the group of candidates, who knows what could happen?, said the adviser, who was quick to caution that there is only a five percent chance the senator will run. The Nuggets have been searching for a consistent third scorer behind Carmelo Anthony and Allen Iverson , and Linas Kleiza filled the role Thursday.
